intro: Kermadecia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty kermadecia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or cream-colored flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky slopes. Kermadecia ferruginea is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
